Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location for Shopping”
Reviews.Author: ParisReally
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and the staff was welcoming, knowledgable, and friendly. The room was spotless, and well appointed. The street noise was noticeable, but hey, it's Paris after all...you're going to have big city noise. The location is fantastic, with tons of great shopping; chains, mega-stores, boutiques and everything in between. Great accessibility to Metro and buses. A good place to stay if you've never been to Paris before and want to be in the middle of the shopping universe.

Reviews.Title: “chic hotel in a chic location”
Reviews.Author: Ngelencer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a Madeleine area, very chic - suitable for those who likes to shop! We arrived very early morning, around 8 am and the front desk were very warm.. I have been to Paris many times, never before the front desk greeted my this nice. Hotel room was as expected - small... but suprisingly the toilet is very spacious! Interior of the room and hotel is modern, chic - just what I wanted.. The room is clean. The only downside is the view... or lack of it! As we only have small window facing inside... nothing to see basically, but if you have the whole Paris to see outside... you don't need nice view from your room :p

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Good transport links with the metro and open top bus tour. The staff were very friendly and helpful, all spoke English. Rooms were clearnly kept and comfortable. Breakfast sufficient, but for EUR 20 you can expect a bit more variety. Wifi cost was not included to the fare. Access to internet a bit of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: lucabran
Reviews.Content: A great position for this hotel, with a very nice staff, good rooms, nice breakfast. Metro very close

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: nika_fiona
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris and I do not regret booking Le Vignon. Friend and I had lots of space for us and our luggage, the room was always cleaned well, and the staff were friendly and helpful. It is very close to Madeleine Metro - so a good location for easily getting around and getting back. Very posh very chic Hotel, great location, amazing customer service. Very Friendly. Met incredibly great people and friends. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - 3 star at best”
Reviews.Author: Tanyamj_126
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel. I had a very pleasant room/experience the first stay and was looking forward to returning. I stay in the area often, but the Vignon is always full. However, this time was quite a disappointment. Everything looks nice on the surface, but if you start looking closely, the hotel is cheap and in need of repairs. The shower was broken and impossible to change the temperature from the cold setting. There are cracks in the walls, chipped paint, dirty carpets, old blankets on the bed, broken electrical sockets ect... Overall, what you would expect from a mediocre 3 start hotel. There are MUCH better hotels to stay in the area in terms of value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are true - a great central location & clean spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Whitticks
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we loved it! This hotel is adorable and comfortable - we had lots of space for the two of us, the room was always cleaned well, and the staff were friendly and helpful. It is very close to Madelaine Metro - so a good location for easily getting around. Keep in mind that not much is open on Sundays. Also, there is a grocery store up the street - a great place to stock up on a few items (we didn't notice it until our last day - but it would have been helpful). Have a great time in Paris! We'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should be rated much higher”
Reviews.Author: lanaQueensland
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favourite's in Paris , this little boutique hotel has a 4 star rating ,with lovely spacious rooms by Paris standards , with clean well presented bathroom ,and stylish bedrooms , tea , coffee making facility ,safe, air conditioning, mini bar, and room service. The hotel is in a great area for shopping, and close to the metro. The only thing that I would change about the hotel would be to paint the corridor in a lighter colour, as a female solo traveller I do not like dark corridors . Also for my taste I like a softer bed . But apart from these minor things , I love this hotel , and will differently stay at Le Vignon 8 again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful small hotel in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTravellers2_11
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Paris and we were very happy with the location of this hotel as you can walk to many of the main tourist attractions and the Metro. The bus stop for the hop on hop off buses is also only 5 minutes away.It is generally comfortable but it was the cheerful women on reception during the day who really made our stay so pleasant as they are so warm and helpful, with very good English. We did not eat breakfast there but bought what we needed from a small supermarket on a nearby boulevard. Highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Birthday”
Reviews.Author: ventnor38
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 14, the hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms were well appointed, small but very comfortable. our quite room at the rear had a six foot bed. The breakfast room has approximatly 24 covers so it could get busy but we did not have any problems. Good 4 stars. but do not expect big hotel chain type of building. It's location make it very central for shopping or tourisum.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: TMitch6542
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel Le Vignon. I thought the decor was very nice, our room, on the 6th (top) floor was very nice and more roomy than I expected. It was a twin superior (or deluxe room, I can't recall) and it had plenty of room for the beds (which were close together). At the foot of the bed, there was an arm chair. There was also a breakfast bar type of table with two small seats, and then yet another arm chair in the corner. The bathroom was large and everthing was extremely clean and updated. There was a mini bar and also a coffee pot in the room. The hotel is air conditioned but the a/c was not working during our stary. Luckily, it was cool at night and we slept with the windows open. The hotel is located on a quiet side street just about a block from the Madelaine. The location is perfect if you want to stay on the Right Bank. You can walk to most of the main attractions quite easily. Also nice is the fact that on the same street as the hotel there are several cafe's and restaurants so that it is easy to grap a cup of coffee or a glass of wine. The hotel doesn't really have a bar, although I believe they serve some beverages in the lobby area. As a guest, you get 30 minutes of free internet, but after that you must pay for it. I see that as the only drawback to this hotel and I woud definitely either stay there again, or refer a friend. Note: if you are tall, you probably don't want a room on the top floor as those rooms on the street side are "in the eaves" and therefore one side of the ceiling is sloped. Might be difficult for a taller person.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but highly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Sir_Thicket
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Vignon for 1 night. We were looking for a nice location that was clean and had some luxury to it. Sadly we felt ripped off by the lack of facilities in the room at this hotel. We booked at booking.com and paid €220 for the night. The room was nicely decorated and was clean. On the down side the room was really quite small and there was a small fridge pushed into the corner for the mini bar. On top of the fridge was a tray with tea/coffee. It felt very huddled together last minute. There was a small 'coffee' table with two office-like chairs at the end of the bed. There was no desk area or table to speak of. For a 4 star hotel I would have expected more and especially for the money we paid. The Internet was also €10 per hour which in the 21st century is extortionate. I would not stay here again. The location is good and it is clean but There are other well located hotels for better overall value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not quite a 4*.”
Reviews.Author: Tiff25
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was in a great location! Almost smack bang in the centre of Paris and very easy to get to on foot. We really enjoyed our stayand would go there again, but I wouldn't say it was a four star. It is a liitle bit overpriced, but isn't everything in Paris. During our stay the airconditioning was out of order which made the rooms very nosey as we had to have the windows open. We were offered breakfast as a compensation as we were checking out, but there was little left. It would have been nice to be asked earlier, but hey ho. We loved Paris and had a great time and the fridge in the room was very useful as we could put all of our drinks we had bought from the supermarket in there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, plenty of room, stylish, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jaans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Vignon for 3 nights in April 2011, this was our first time in Paris. The location is superb because it's in the center of Paris but on a relatively quiet side-street. One of the major shopping streets (Boulevard Haussman) is just a few minutes walk away and the area surrounding the hotel is full of various shops, cafes and restaurants. Champs-Elysées and the Louvre are no more than 10 minutes walking distance. I shoul point out that Champs-Elysées itself is a relatively long street and the busier part along with the Arc de Triomphe is at the further end. Most of the major sites are within walking distance (20-30 min) but if staying for only a few days like we did, I would recommend riding one way on the metro to Notre Dame Cathedral or the Eiffel Tower. As for the hotel itself, we were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. Having looked at tens of hotels in Paris and reading A LOT of reviews, I understood that rooms in Parisian hotels are smaller than usual. We booked a regular room without any extras so we were prepared for a tiny room with just enough space to move around the bed but the room was spacious and even included a comfortable sitting area with a table and 2 chairs. There were also tea and coffe making facilites, a minibar, safe, satellite TV and air-conditioning in the room. Our room (no.51, 5th floor) was stylishly decorated with a modern style but also had a distinctly Parisian feel to it. There was a little bit of wear but the finishing materials were of good quality and it was a non-issue for us. The room was clean and housekeeping visited twice a day. When we arrived we noticed that one of the bedside lamps was not working but when we returned a few hours later it was already fixed (we didn't even mention it to the staff). The personell were very friendly and our room was already waiting for us when we arrived at 14 o'clock. We made our reservation through booking.com and everything was exactly as we requested. After we checked-out they were happy to watch our suitcase at the reception because we had an evening flight and wanted to roam around Paris for a few more hours. They even helped us print out our airplane tickets. All-in-all the staff was very nice and helpful. We didn't have any breakfast at the hotel so I can't comment on the restaurant. The only con that I could think of is the price of WiFi which cost 10€ for 1h and 29€ for 24h. On the plus side there was a desktop PC in the lobby which could be used for free. I should also mention that our room rate (classical room) was 140/160€ per day but the list price is 250 to 300€. For the money we paid the hotel was fantastic but at 300€ I would probably expect a little bit more.

Reviews.Title: “enchanting paris first-time holiday”
Reviews.Author: xiangchang7
Reviews.Content: first of all, blandine is amasing concierge greeter. this place was so exquisitely charming. initially, we had stayed on the left bank of paris (at a commercial hotel - which was also great ) however, did not have the charm and delicateness of hotel le vignon. the accomodations and service was exceptional. i recently acquired a facebook account and have as my profile photo a red-door which is directly across from the hotel. i am in process of posting those photos - so wanted to acknowledge what an EXCEPTIONAL experience i had at hotel le vignon. salut! merci beuacoup. xiang - xiang.cclc7@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ahmadm
Reviews.Content: Just the perfect place to stay in especially if you love shopping. I stayed there for almost 5 nights in this welcoming hotel with the most friendly staff. They were extremely nice and helpful that made my whole experience of exploring Paris more enjoyable. Definitely will stay there again in my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel of Paris”
Reviews.Author: chathuranga
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated center to many big attractions. Its location compared with the price is excellent. Since its a 4 star hotel, and the service offered for the price paid is unique to the other hotels in the same area. The hotel staff is very friendly and attentive. They warmly welcome anyone with a smile and is always ready to help in any circumstance. There are many restaurants and cafes around. So its very convenient to buy anything. Rooms are quite larger compared to normal European hotel rooms. The bathroom is very spacious. This is a star factor since usually the bathroom in European hotel rooms is so small that you need to pack in like a Sardine. This hotel is Worth for the money you pay. I'm sure to visit again at a time I visit Paris

Reviews.Title: “nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: chetan_salunkhe
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very good and cosy. The rooms are small but it is standard in all big cities in Europe. The hotel staff is very nice and accomodative. Most of them are english speaking. best part of the hotel is location which right in the center of city and also near to the train station (RER).

Reviews.Title: “You can't fault the Staff and the Location”
Reviews.Author: Raynboz
Reviews.Content: Who said French people were arrogant and not helpful ? The Manager of this little hotel could not have been more friendly and helpful if she tried !! The location is central to everything - just walk or take the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: EPWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: The best selling point of this hotel is location. It's a walking distance to Louvre, Place de Concorde, even Champs Elysees. Our room (we stayed at a Superior room) was quite small for what we paid, but no regrets here. The front desk staff was polite and gave us good restaurant recommendations in the area (Martin was the best).

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mercyngrace
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Vignon provided friendly service and pleasant accommodations. The location is excellent-close to 2 metro stations and many shops and restaurants yet is quiet and very clean. This is a boutique hotel- small and cute- which is exactly what I wanted for my trip to Paris. Except that meant the TV was tiny and had only about 8 stations, and on Sunday night when I returned around midnight after a wonderful dinner, the hotel door was locked and the lights were out! No worries though. The front desk person showed up promptly when we rang the doorbell. This place is ideal for those who desire great location, small, quiet and clean rooms with nice little amenities like warm towel rack, fresh robes, and turn down service. It is not for those who prefer luxuries like large concierge, goose down beds, and fancy tv's.

Reviews.Title: “What a location”
Reviews.Author: Shelly112220
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in the centre of the most wonderful shopping in Paris. Group of 4 women looking for a weekend of indulgence. We did not have to go far....Very comfortable accomodation. Rooms were clean, bed comfortable and decor soothing. Robes a nice touch and unexpected. Breakfast was just right. Staff were incredibly helpful and had great recommendations. Metro so close, but we walked everywhere. Would definately choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: GretaCargo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Paris and stayed at the Hotel Le Vignon and were very pleased. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was a superior room on the fourth floor. The view out the window was not much but the room was very quiet and spacious by Paris standards. We appreciated the nice linens and the bathrobes and slippers that were provided. The bath was white marble and was immaculate. Evening turn down service and towel replacement is something one would not expect at this price point. The breakfast was more that adequate and included a good assortment of cheese, fruit, cereals, smoked salmon and breads. The location on a quiet street near the Madeline Church is very convenient to the Metro, department stores and the Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, contemporary, colourful”
Reviews.Author: Oldhanwellian
Reviews.Content: We visit Paris once or twice a year, usually staying on the Left Bank but this time, with shopping in mind, decided to look for somewhere close to the grands magasins. The reviews of Le Vignon made it sound appealing, so we booked for just one night. It more than lives up to the praises heaped on it by other reviewers. The discreet entrance is tucked between shops in a little shopping street with all kinds of interesting small shops selling a wide range of things - honey, gloves, cashmere, charcuterie, a restaurant with a MIchelin bib, a brasserie, a perfumerie - and in late November it was festooned with Christmas lights. We were with friends - we had booked a 'superior' room and they had opted for a standard. Ours, on the second floor, overlooked an unexciting inner well, but was wonderfully quiet, a good size, especially for Paris, with seating for three and a cheerful contemporary decor. Our friends' room, on the sixth floor, was smaller but perfectly adequate and full of character, with sloping ceilings and a huge beam across the bath. Our room on the second floor merited a rating of five stars, but theirs was less peaceful and the constant intermittent noise of a generator or some other electrical equipment disturbed their sleep; otherwise the rooms would have got a five. The receptionist did offer them a free breakfast when they mentioned it (and at 15 euros for breakfast this is a more generous offer than it sounds. Breakfast at Paul just down the road is 4.10 euros). The price of breakfast, and charging for the use of the internet, is the reason for a four rating for value. The hotel is very well located for shopping, about three minutes from Galeries Lafayette and Printemps, and in an area of small, independent, individual shops of the kind that hardly exist in London any more. And it's near a couple of metro stations and all the buses along boulevard Haussman, so it's easy to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a gem”
Reviews.Author: JerryStein
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10-day trip to Paris in which we stayed 4-nights at a large chain to start and then the last 4 nights at the hotel Le Vignon. I was thoroughly impressed by the friendliness, cleanliness and quiet location. The four front desk staff were very, very helpful and patient! Our 6th floor room had plenty of space. The area is close enough to walk or cab it to the historical sites and shopping although we walked everywhere. We travel a lot and read Trip Advisor before booking. As usual we were pleased by the accuracy of the reviews. The hotel is in the middle of a quiet business street with unique little shops and restaurants on it. It was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jmw245
Reviews.Content: Superbly located, this hotel is on a quiet street populated by specialty gourmet stores such as La Maison de Miel, Truffle house as well as Brugg's chocolate house. There are a number of pastry shops as well. It is steps away from Printemp and Concord, and we were able to walk everywhere. It is a small and relatively simple 4-star hotel, but it does the work. It is clean and bathroom is of decent size. Staff was very nice and courteous. Of all our stays in the 8th arrondisment, this one should certainly be revisited. The complimentary use of internet in the lobby helps a great deal as well.

Reviews.Title: “My special place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: EamonnLeeds
Reviews.Content: I have visited this hotel for a number of years now - and I can say it is always like coming home. The location is perfect in the centre of Paris and yet is is always tranquil and relaxed . Comfortable and contemporary in style, perfectly clean and so welcoming. I stay at hotels all over Europe and this is by far and away my favourite Last and by no means least I hope you are lucky enough to be greeted by Fabienne at reception - then your stay will be complete. Fabienne is the epitomy of Parisien sophistication. All the staff are friendly and welcoming A great find ............... Enjoy Eamonn Burke - Leeds UK

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: AndreNewYork
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location right in the heart of Paris yet at night it becomes an oasis of tranqulity! Small boutique hotel with beautiful decoration and very personal service! One of the best service team in the industry and it comes from somebdoy who travels 60-70% for business (Fabienne is the best!). Rooms are very comfortable with nice touches like free Mariage Freres tea; bathrooms are bigger than in some big chain hotels! Great restaurants right around the corner from the hotel! Try it - you will not be dissapointed! Andre from NY

Reviews.Title: “Notre Maison Secondaire”
Reviews.Author: JandELondon
Reviews.Content: Some years ago we were fortunate to find this bright elegant small hotel in a quiet street in the centre of Paris, a few yards from the Place Madeleine. The welcome we received from the beginning from Fabienne and her colleagues has ensured that we return at least twice a year. Any request is dealt with cheerfully and immediately. The peaceful bedrooms are well equipped with minibar, safe deposit, tea and coffee making facilities, with two little fresh madeleines delivered each day. Fluffy bathrobes and slippers and plenty of towels are provided in the bathrooms. The linen provided on the comfortable beds is always crisp and fresh and the domestic staff ensure that rooms and service are first class. The buffet breakfast is served in a bright room with muesli, cereals, charcuterie, cheeses, breads, toast, fresh fruit and juices and ample hot beverages. The hotel is well served by the Metro and buses and its central position makes it ideal for exploring Paris on foot. In spite of the weakness of sterling against the euro, we consider Le Vignon to be excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “acceuil chaleureux”
Reviews.Author: Jcob
Reviews.Content: I am a long time client of the hotel Le vignon, I am very much impressed, each visite, of the reception that Fabiene gives me and others, her warm welcome is so appreciated, she makes me feel, that the hotel, is "my home away from home". I come to Paris twice a year, with pleasure. I must a add, that Fabiene makes certain, that the entire staff is helpfull. Michele Rodri, Los Angeles, California

Reviews.Title: “The Le Vignon is a true gem”
Reviews.Author: jcmunich
Reviews.Content: We travel to Paris 2 times a year and have stayed in many hotels. We are so happy to have found this wonderful little gem. We do not like big hotels and prefer smaller boutique style hotels. Unortunately, a lot of small hotels now term themselves "boutique" but they are not really homely or family run. This hotel is different! The rooms are wonderful, the reception staff is very kind, the room service (breakfast) is wonderful and the location of the hotel could not be more central. I wish some of the larger hotels would take this hotel as an example. We stayed for a week and were given a wonderful room on the top floor and to our amazement, even the bathroom was a good size and had windows! Not common in many Parisian hotels. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LillyRJ
Reviews.Content: This is a realy pleasant hotel. The staff is very kind and they do speak English (I even found some who spoke Portuguese!). The rooms are quiet and very clean. They are also big, considering the usual hotel rooms in Paris, and its bathroom is very good with its powerful and hot shower. The price in not cheap, but ir is not expensive either (we paid 180 euros per day in a double room). The breakfast is expensive (15 to 20 euros) but good and since there are not many places around to eat (try "Chez Cecile") it is still an option. The hotel is in the 8éme arrondissement, very close to the Madeleine Church, to a metro station and to the big magazines (Printemps and Galleries Lafayettes). In fact, it is close enough to most places, since I have visited them all walking. I would definitely stay in this hotel again. In fact, I look forward to doing so in a very near future!

Reviews.Title: “My Hotel My lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: alajenny
Reviews.Content: Dear Vignon, thank you for such lovely time we had, especially Norbert so helpfull, available and handsome, we love you, hope to meet you. the only bad point is some days old lady (the owner?) was insisting to speak so high, pitty for this very quiet hotel. best wishes, Alan & Jenny

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: TravellersCanada
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for 6 nights. We know Paris and go on a regular basis and we usually stay in the 8th. I decided to try this hotel based on Tripadvisor's review. Well, our problem was that we prepaid for our room. They have major plumbing problems! On the first day we told them that the shower head was leaking and they said they would fixed it. Then one morning we get dirty toilet water leaking on our heads while we our brushing our teeth! An existing trap door on the ceiling with cracks and peeling paint tells you that this is longstanding. They pretended that this was a new problem - typically french! ! Also during the night, we heard mice in the walls! When we complained, they offered us an inferior room! This is not a 4 star, it's a cutsy little hotel that had a shoemaker as a plumber and they try to hide and patch it up since it is too major. There are much better hotels in Paris for the price. This one is not on our list!

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay at Le vignon”
Reviews.Author: lawahoo2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in May, after previously staying for seven nights in 2006. They gave us the same upgraded room (Room 61), which we loved. Pros: 1. The sheets/linens are of the highest quality. 2. Large room (for Paris) and bathroom 3. Great hotel location - easy access to sights, restaurants, shopping, and Metro stop (Madeleine) Cons: 1. Toilet always smelled like the sewer (but you could close the door to the toilet - yes, it had it's own door - and that buffered some of the smell) 2. Can hear noise in the hallways from your room 3. Service was hit or miss - we loved Fabienne at the front desk (who we got to know last year), but when others were on call, they were not as helpful (for example, one woman agreed to book us a taxi to the train station the day we were leaving; we asked her to do this the night before, but she never did it; we had to have a taxi called the next morning - thankfully, we did not miss our train).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: littlemisschillyrub
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel Le Vignon located at 23 Rue Vignon in the Madeleine/Opera district (those are also the nearest metro stops) and what a wonderful time we had. We booked a few months in advance in order to celebrate our anniversary. When I told the hotel this they included a bottle of champagne in the quote which was a nice touch. None of the other hotels we were considering at the time offered so this was a nice touch! We booked a deluxe room rather than their standard rooms (they refer to them Superior rms) because they were slightly bigger and faced the back but to be honest while we were there we saw the superior rooms and there isn't much in it, infact they seemed lighter because they faced the street but I don't know whether they would be noisey. Our room had coffee/tea making facilities, sky tv and a little lounge area to sit and watch tv. On the few occasions we ordered room service they were very quick and very friendly. The staff on reception were extremely helpful and kind, as soon as we arrived they brought the champagne to our room and wished us well. Most nights we would ask them to recommend a restaurant which they did and booked us in with no problems. The first night they sent us to a restaurant called L'Envue on 39, rue Boissy (5 minutes from the hotel) which was really nice, lovely food and well presented, infact it's a shame we were so tired and couldn't appreciate it fully. The second night my boyfriend booked us into L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon on 7, rue de Montalembert which I would highly recommend, great food with a buzzy atmosphere and situated just off the chic Saint Germain. It's better suited to intimate dining rather than groups because the restaurant is designed so you are sitting at a bar essentially. The third and last night the hotel booked us into Le Moulin da la Galette on 83, rue Lepic which is in the area of the Moulin Rouge. Again lovely food not as good as the previous nights but very enjoyable. Lunch we grabbed as and when, we found a good cafe near the hotel called Fauchon Paris at 26-30 Place de la Madeleine which sold great french pastries amongst other things i.e. wine/cheese etc. Good place to get presents for home. Another if you are near the Notre Dame is (wait for it) Cafe Quasimodo!! As you can tell from the name it is geared at tourists but it's simple and does just the job for some food while on the move. With regards to the sightseeing, we saw the famour land marks mostly by going on the Les Cars Rouges tour bus, which cost €22 each (which we got from outside the Eiffel Tower) plus we paid a further €8 each for the Seine Cruise with Bateaux Parisiens. The tour bus tickets were valid for 2 days and the boat trip was valid for a month. If you need airport transfers then use the Roissy Bus which operates between the Airport and the Opera district which is perfect for staying at Hotel Le Vignon as the stop is 2 streets away. The cost was €8.50 per person (one way) and it took about 45mins, no need to pre book. I hope this all helps, you really wouldn't be disappointed with booking Hotel Le Vignon. Great location, great service!!

Reviews.Title: “Such a disapointing hotel...”
Reviews.Author: JamyLondon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed q few days in Paris for our wedding Anniversary and booked this lovely boutique hotel through website....even if the quality/price was not bad at all (180 euros per night for a suite) when we arrived, the lobby hotel was not the same as the one we saw on the website picture. No bar, no restaurant, no gym, no house Porter for a 4 star hotel....????? Only smoked salmon and foie gras can be provided by the room service....we paid 20 euros per person for breakfast...and had to share a croissant once!!!! Too expensive for just a coffee and french bread. the reception staff was okbut don"t ask them too much about the places to visit or you will really have the impression to bore them... We wish we could have had a better stay in this charming city with booking a real 4 star hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Top location, welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: kobri
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Le vignon for 2 nights and the impression is very positive. The location is absolutely fantastic. You're in 5 minutes in Grand Magazines, Place Vendome or Opera. The hotel is located in a small, but rather busy street. Our room was to the street, and you could hear the noise, but actually it was not disturbing at all. In the street you have a couple of nice shops and some cafes, where you can get a cheap lunch. The breakfast in the hotel is more than you can expect from french breakfast. I have expected to have a usual croissant with caffee, but they serve some fruit, and eggs, and ham, and salmon. Of course, that's not a breakfast you get at Ritz, but still... The rooms are small, but cosy. Everything very clean. The staff is most helpful. They made all the restaurant bookings for us. After we have returned home, I have discovered that I've forgotten the key in a room safe. The hotel have sent the key to us without any charge. The only point of disconvinience was, that the hotel don't have any parking opportunities. But that is typical problem for hotels in Paris. And because of good location, it was easy to find a parking space at the nearby parkings of Lafayette or Printemps. It is a right hotel for you, if you don't expect a five-star luxury, but still a very good accomodation for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and welcoming hotel nr Madeleine”
Reviews.Author: bettyjo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend who asked us not tell anyone about the hotel as she didn't want it to become too popular as it is such a hidden gem, but wanted to name and praise! Had a wonderful 4 night stay over the New Year period with my husband for our honeymoon! Although this hotel is not ulta-luxury it is small, friendly, and extremely well looked after, and made for a relaxing and romantic stay in Paris. The location is excellent, particularly for a first visit to Paris, and I would most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a great time”
Reviews.Author: MarleeandKT
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at Le Vignon for 6 nights early September and we had a great time. The Hotel is situated in a perfect location close the main dept. stores, Fauchon and the Madeline is perfect for the subway and Open tour bus....There are lots of restaurants nearby and the main attractions are within walking distance......Can't thank Fabienne and Christophe enough for their attentive and welcoming service...Would thoroughly recommend this hotel. Nothing was too much trouble and the rooms were pleasant, clean and reasonably roomy (for Paris) Thanks again and can't wait to see you in Sydney one day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at Le Vignon”
Reviews.Author: aoka
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms for 4 nights at Le Vignon during the last week of August and had a very pleasant stay. The rooms looked a little older than what was shown on their website but were very clean, nicely decorated, and decent size for Paris. Their breakfast was very good and their bread and pastries were one of the best we had in Paris. All of the hotel staff, from the front desk to the breakfast room, were very friendly and helpful. We also found the location to be very convenient, especially for shopping. You can walk to most of the sights and the metro stop (Madeleine) was 2-3 minutes away, and the RER stop (Auber) was 4-5 minutes away. We recommend that you get a room facing the street. We were first given a room facing the back and found it to be dark and damp, so we had our room switched. The street facing room was a lot brighter and the windows must be good because once closed, the noise from the street did not bother us at all. The air conditioning worked okay but might not be sufficient for hot summer days. I would recommend staying at Le Vignon if you are staying on the Right Bank. Also, the pot-au-feu restaurant down the street was excellent for a reasonable price (about 20 euros).

Reviews.Title: “Charming...”
Reviews.Author: JackSD
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Vignon is a cheerful, comfortable and conveniently located upscale boutique hotel near the heart of Paris. The staff is very efficient and English-fluent, there is reliable wireless internet service, and the hotel is walking distance from fashionable shops and restaurants -- less than 10 minutes from the Place de la Concorde, for example. Rooms on high floors are quiet, room a/c is quiet and up-to-date, and bathrooms are bright and spotless. The hotel would be perfect, if it weren't for a less-than-average (for French hotels) breakfast buffet -- which featured very bitter, almost undrinkable coffee when I was there -- and the slightly bedraggled quality of the block where it's located. But if you want to be near the center of working and playing Paris, this is a warm and very pleasant option.
